repnme.cdata!: Chad - National Transport Program Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Transport
            Program (NTP) Support Project for Chad were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was substantial, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the project
            components were clearly linked to the objectives of the NTP,
            thus favoring a clear assessment of its outcomes with
            respect to national transport targets. Maintaining this
            approach in future operations will be a major contribution
            to sustaining the NTP as long term framework. A fortunate
            but unforeseen situation was the financing of part of the
            civil works with the government's petroleum resources.
            With a cost increase in US dollar terms of nearly 74 percent
            on the road rehabilitation component, the project will
            evidently have fallen short of its planned objectives, since
            such a cost increase and associated financing shortfalls
            were not anticipated in the risk analysis and Bank financing
            was not flexible to accommodate additional costs. At project
            preparation, a good set of performance indicators were
            designed, but not supported with a well articulated
            monitoring and evaluation framework; the latter only being
            prepared at the beginning of the project. Performance
            indicators without a comprehensive monitoring and assessment
            framework defined at design stage may lead to many pitfalls.
            Continuous and close monitoring is essential to ensure that
            steady progress and effective supervision are maintained to
            readily address essential and specific needs during
            implementation. A periodic classification of contractors to
            ensure that only well qualified contractors are allowed to
            compete is essential in the Chadian context to avoid poor
            contract performance. In addition, supervision missions need
            to put more emphasis on procurement and financial management
            through the use of external technical support.

5081744.trustfund:
TF039915-CHAD - ROAD SAFETY AUDITING OF
            PROJECT ROADS

repnme.cdata!: Chad - National Transport Program Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the National Transport Program
            Support Project seeks to reduce poverty and rural isolation,
            by improving access to markets, and services, particularly
            in rural areas, improve national food security, and,
            contribute to reduced consumer prices for basic consumption.
            The components are: 1) investments in road upgrading, and
            paving, specifically for a key road segment on the main
            east-west axis of the country, and, rehabilitation of
            existing paved roads. Civil works will rebuild the existing
            road alignment, raise the road to prevent flooding, and
            includes earthworks, pavement, and drainage works; 2) a
            pilot program for performance-based road management, and
            maintenance contract for unpaved roads, to ensure transit,
            and road maintenance. It should be noted that substantial
            technical assistance was provided in the establishment of
            the model contract; 3) to establish institutional capacity
            in support of a National Road Safety Program, through
            technical assistance, and training provision, including
            physical road safety signaling, mainly in urban areas; 4) to
            support the Rural Travel and Transport Program, ensuring
            access to markets, and economic/social goods and services,
            by the rural population; 5) to support institutional
            capacity building through training, consulting services, and
            operational practices; and, 6) to reduce HIV/AIDS risk
            incidence, through awareness, and education campaigns.

693048.trustfund:
TF039915-CHAD - ROAD SAFETY AUDITING OF
            PROJECT ROADS

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Programme National des Transports :
            etude d'impact sur l'environnement

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the National Transport Project for Chad, which consists of
            resurfacing, reinforcing, and rehabilitating paved and
            unpaved roads as well as their periodic and regular
            maintenance. The only two components in which negative
            environmental consequences are anticipated are those
            concerning highway and aerial transport infrastructure. The
            impacts and their mitigations include the following:
            Displaced soil will be reconstituted for land cultivation.
            To combat soil erosion, drains and borrow pits will be
            built, protective zones set up around hydraulic works, areas
            reforested and replanted, and slopes stabilized. Liquid and
            solid waste will be managed. Greenbelt zones will be
            planted. Dust and air-borne diseases will be reduced by
            water spraying. Traffic injuries and hazards will be
            controlled by maintaining the construction site, using
            signs, and building access roads, and parallel walkways for
            pedestrians. A water purification system will be built at
            the airport. Public toilets will alleviate underground water
            pollution. Enclosures will surround airport platforms. An
            awareness and prevention campaign will control the spread of
            sexually transmitted diseases among workers and the population.
